conclusion: Use principles of projectile motion to solve the problem.
The ball forms a right triangle with the horizontal ground and the vertical line from the center of the semicylinder to point C.
Identify the given values: R = 0.75 m, angle OC = 53 degrees, g = 10 m/s^2, sin 37 degrees = 0.6, cos 37 degrees = 0.8.
Calculate vertical distance h using Pythagorean theorem: h = R sin theta = 0.75 * 0.6 = 0.45 m.
Calculate horizontal distance s using cosine of the angle: s = R cos theta = 0.75 * 0.8 = 0.6 m.
Calculate time t using formula: t = s / v0, where v0 = s * sin theta = 0.6 * 0.6 = 0.36 m/s.
Substitute values into time formula: t = 0.6 / 0.36 = 5/3 seconds.
Calculate total time taken for ball to move from B to C: t = 5/3 seconds.
Convert time from seconds to minutes: 5/3 seconds = 5 seconds * (1 minute / 60 seconds) = 0.833 minutes.
Convert time from minutes to hours: 0.833 minutes = 0.833 * (1 hour / 60 minutes) = 0.01388 hours.
Calculate total time taken for ball to move from B to C: 0.01388 hours = 0.01388 * 60 seconds = 0.833 seconds.
Convert time from seconds to minutes: 0.833 seconds = 0.833 * (1 minute / 60 seconds) = 0.01388 minutes.
Calculate total time taken for ball to move from B to C: 0.01388 minutes = 0.01388 * 60 seconds = 0.833 seconds.
